topics.title: Opening: receiving feedback with gratitude
topics.summary: Jules shares how he intentionally responds positively to feedback even when it stings internally, because it encourages more feedback and accelerates improvement.

topics.title: Introduction and Background
topics.summary: Lenny introduces the show and Jules Walter, highlighting his roles at YouTube and Slack plus his nonprofit work, and previews a deep dive on skills and mentorship.

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: Sponsor messages for Vanta (SOC 2 compliance automation) and Notion (all-in-one collaboration workspace).

topics.title: Jules’ career journey: Haiti to YouTube
topics.summary: Jules walks through his path from Haiti to CS/business school, medical devices, a failed startup, then PM roles in the Bay Area culminating in leading YouTube Primetime Channels.

topics.title: Breaking into product management paths
topics.summary: They discuss how hard it is to enter PM and common entry routes: joining a startup to get PM experience or transferring internally by leveraging domain expertise.

topics.title: First growth PM at Slack: learning fast
topics.summary: Jules explains taking the growth role as a way into Slack despite no growth background, then using a learning mindset and mentors to ship impactful activation improvements quickly.

topics.title: Nonprofits: CodePath and Black PMs Network
topics.summary: Jules describes co-founding CodePath and Black PMs to increase diversity in tech, how they scaled, and the origin story of Black PMs growing from ~15 people to 1,000+.

topics.title: Key PM skills: IQ vs EQ buckets
topics.summary: Jules frames PM growth as building IQ (execution, product sense, strategy) early and EQ (communication, leadership, management) later as scope and ambiguity increase.

topics.title: Interviewing as a career skill: mock practice
topics.summary: They emphasize interview skill as a major career lever; Jules recommends dozens of mock interviews, notes the lack of feedback from companies, and shares his own repeated Google attempts.

topics.title: Underrepresented candidates: stress, belonging, support
topics.summary: Jules explains extra psychological load for underrepresented candidates during interviews and recommends practicing in supportive small groups to reduce stress and build confidence.

topics.title: EQ skills: communication, self-awareness, blind spots
topics.summary: Jules details how seniority demands better communication and self-awareness; mentors helped him identify patterns like withdrawing under stress and misreading questions as disagreement.

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: Sponsor message for Linear (issue tracking and product development workflows).

topics.title: How Jules builds skills: outcomes, questions, mentors
topics.summary: Jules shares a repeatable learning method: define a concrete outcome, work backward into questions, do light reading, then learn directly from experts and iterate with results.

topics.title: Learning by observing great artifacts and process
topics.summary: He explains improving strategy/execution by reverse-engineering strong docs, watching top PMs run meetings, saving templates, and learning from the iterative ‘backstage’ process.

topics.title: Building EQ: feedback loops, coaching, one skill focus
topics.summary: Jules describes EQ development via reading (e.g., Pyramid Principle), collecting examples, asking for feedback, coaching/group coaching, and focusing on one skill for months (e.g., listening).
